title: FTX Foundation Launches $1 Billion Future Fund Using Effective Altruism as Ideological Cover
description: Sam Bankman-Fried launches the FTX Future Fund with $100 million in initial grants and pledges to distribute $1 billion total, leveraging Effective Altruism philosophy to deflect scrutiny from questionable crypto operations. The fund, run by EA leaders including William MacAskill, distributed grants for global health, pandemic prevention, and climate change while masking systematic wealth extraction from FTX customer funds.

title: Joseph Bankman Orchestrates $5.5 Million FTX Donation Campaign to Stanford University
description: SBF's father Joseph Bankman, a Stanford Law professor, directs $5.5 million in FTX customer funds to Stanford University between November 2021 and May 2022, including $4 million for pandemic preparedness research and $500,000 to Stanford Law School. The donations represented a systematic academic capture operation using family connections to legitimize FTX operations while enriching the Bankman family's institutional standing.

title: SBF Launches $80 Million Bipartisan Political Influence Campaign Using Stolen Customer Funds
description: Sam Bankman-Fried systematically deploys approximately $80 million in FTX customer funds for bipartisan political influence, publicly donating $40 million to Democrats while secretly funding an equal amount to Republicans through 'dark money' channels and co-conspirators. The operation specifically targets Senate Agriculture Committee members overseeing crypto regulation, including Senators Debbie Stabenow and John Boozman, to secure favorable legislation and regulatory capture.
